Authors: Riantini R.E., Andini S., Florencia M.M., Rabiah A.S.
Title: E-Marketing Strategy Analysis of Consumer Purchase Decision in Indonesia Online Sports Stores
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: International Marketing Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Riantini, R.E., International Marketing Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Andini, S., Management Department, BINUS Online Learning, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Florencia, M.M., International Marketing Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Rabiah, A.S., International Marketing Program, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This study aims to determine the effect of E-Marketing Marketing Mix on Purchase Decisions on online retail consumers of sports product sellers in Indonesia where in this study was conducted at PT. Decathlon Sport Indonesia because this company already has several cabins in Indonesia. The type of research used is exploratory research with a quantitative approach. The sampling technique uses random sampling. The number of samples used in this study amounted to 100 respondents. Methods of collecting data through questionnaires. The data analysis technique used is descriptive analysis and multiple linear regression analysis. The results of the study show that the obtained Fcount is 23,323 with a significance of 0,000. Ftable which is known to be alpha 5% or 0.05 of 0.361. The results of these calculations indicate that Fcount is greater than Ftable, which is 23.332> 0.361 with a smaller significance than alpha, which is 0.000 <0.005. Based on the results of the t test it can be seen that there are four groups of independent variables which partially have a significant influence on purchasing decisions; 4Ps (Product, Price, Place, Promotion), P2 (Personalization, Privacy), C2 (Customer Service, Community), and S2 (Site, Security). The dominant group of variables on purchasing decisions are P2 (Personalization, Privacy) and S2 (Site, Security). © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: community; customer service; personalization; place; price; privacy; product; promotion; purchase decision; security; site
Index Keywords: Commerce; Data privacy; Information management; Linear regression; Purchasing; Sports; Surveys; community; Customer services; Personalizations; place; price; product; promotion; Purchase decision; security; site; Sales

Authors: Pradipta I.A., Felia J., Rabiah A.S.
Title: Brand attitude, purchase intention, perceptual mapping of slim-type napkin market, and competitive strategy for charm body fit super Slim
Source title: Pertanika Journal of Social Sciences and Humanities
Affiliations: Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University (BINUS), Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pradipta, I.A., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University (BINUS), Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Felia, J., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University (BINUS), Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia; Rabiah, A.S., Management Department, BINUS Business School Undergraduate Program, Bina Nusantara University (BINUS), Jakarta Barat, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The objective of this study is to analyse the influence of brand attitude factors on purchase intention, the comparison of brand attitude factors, the positioning of the Charm Body Fit Super Slim in the slim-type female napkin market and recommend competitive strategy for Charm Body Fit Super Slim. The study adopted qualitative and quantitative methodology including content analysis. Independent sample t-test, multiple regression, and multidimensional scaling were used to analyse data. The study sample was 100 people in addition to interviewing 10 respondents for an in-depth analysis. The results confirmed Brand Attitude had no significant persistent influence on purchase intention. There is significant influence of product quality, attitude on price, attitude on brand perception and usage attitude on purchase intention. There is no significant effect on purchase intention of product attributes, attitude on advertising, and in-store promotion. The positioning of Charm is the slim-type female napkin brand that is quality oriented. The study recommends competitive strategy in the form of product development using Japanese R & D technology, price promotion with tagline “Anti Spread Anti Leak, No Pouch No Worry”, and campaign #SayYesToSlim. © Universiti Putra Malaysia Press.
Author Keywords: Brand attitude; Competitive strategy; Positioning; Purchase intention
References: Akdeniz, A.R., Aybeniz, Effect of perceived values on the brand preference and the purchase intention (2012) European Scientific Journal, 8 (17), pp. 1-17; (2011) Kajian Profil Penduduk Remaja (10-24 THN): Ada Apa Dengan Remaja?, , http://www.bkkbn.go.id/litbang/pusdu/Hasil%2520PenelitianKarakteristik%2520Demografis/2011/Kajian%2520Profil%2520Penduduk%2520Remaja%2520(10%2520-%252024%2520tahun).pdf, Retrieved Januari 25, 2016, from; (2013) The Chambers 100, , Chambers London: Michael Chambers; Gunawan, A., Diana, B., Muchardie, B.G., Sitinjak, M.F., The effect of involvement and Electronic Word of Mouth (eWOM) on brand image and its impact on consumers brand switching of Mamypoko (2016) International Journal of Economics and Management, 10 (S1), pp. 19-31; (2014) Baby Diaper Users Media Report 2014, , http://www.nielsen.com/us/en/insights/reports.html, Retrieved November 7, 2016; Tseng, L., Lee, T., Investigating the factors influence tweens’ purchase intention through peer conformity in Taiwan (2013) Advances in Management & Applied Economics, 3 (3), pp. 259-277

Authors: Hendriana E., Pradipta I.A., Cheng W., Gunawan A., Rabiah A.S.
Title: Analysis of online travel market segmentation based on behavioral intention factors with TALC model in Jakarta
Source title: Proceedings of 2016 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2016
Affiliations: Putra Business School, University of Putra Malaysia, Serdang, Selangor, Malaysia; School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hendriana, E., Putra Business School, University of Putra Malaysia, Serdang, Selangor, Malaysia; Pradipta, I.A., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Cheng, W., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Gunawan, A., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Rabiah, A.S., School of Business Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The market of online travel, particularly online airline ticket, has potential to grow continuously in Indonesia. However, the pre-test results showed that the mainstream market has not had a strong behavioral intention to buy airline ticket online. This study aims to determine the factors that significantly affect consumer behavioral intention to buy airline ticket online and to know the consumer segmentation of online airline ticket according to Technology Adoption Life Cycle (TALC) model. Data were collected by distributing questionnaires to 100 respondents in Jakarta and analysed using linear regression analysis, cluster analysis, and cross-tabulation. The results showed that there were 13 factors having significant effect on consumer behavioral intention to buy airline ticket online, and had acquired 4 segments in the market of online airline ticket named Explorer, Pacemaker, Partaker, and Pursuer based on the thirteen behavioral intention factors, ages, and daily internet usage. © 2016 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Behavioral Intention; Chasm Marketing; Online Consumer Behavior; Online Travel; Technology Adoption Life Cycle
Index Keywords: Cluster analysis; Commerce; Information management; Life cycle; Regression analysis; Surveys; Talc; Airline tickets; Behavioral intention; Indonesia; Internet usage; Market segmentation; Online consumer behavior; Online Travel; Technology adoption; Consumer behavior
